transcripts.prompt: Please transcribe the text from the following image with high accuracy. transcripts.original_text: State of New York Montgomery Margaret Timmerman being duly sworn deposth and saith that she is aged sixty seven years that she was acquainted with Henry House and Nancy House at the time they were married that she was present at the wedding and that she was also married at the same time at my fathers house in >>> in said county ceremony on the fifteenth day of February 1789 and that she knows that the said Henry House and Nancy his wife lives together for some time in the same town where she this deponent did in said town of >>> further south >>> Sworn and >>> before me this 4th day of September 1838 John Haven, Justice of the Peace Margaret Timmerman X her mark I John Haven a Justice of the Peace of the town of >>> in the county of Montgomery before whom the >>> of >>> was taken to hereby certify that I am well acquainted with Margaret Timmerman and do know her to be a person of good character for truth and veracity and her statement entitled to credit and that she was not taught to write and did mark her mark all before me September 4th, 1838. John Hawn, Justice State of New York Montgomery County Clerks Office I certify that John W. Hawn esq. whole name is subscribed to the Justice of the forgoing affidavit and proceedings was on the day of the date >>> a Justice of the Peace >>> and for the County of Montgomery duly elected and >>> and that the signature to the same is his genuine signature.
transcripts.extracted_text: State of New York } Montgomery County }  I, Margaret Zimmerman being duly sworn doth depose & state that she is aged sixty seven years that she was acquainted with Henry House and Nancy House at the time they were married that she was present at the Wedding and that she was also married at the same time at my father's House in Minden in said county and that Dominie Reel performed the marriage ceremony on the fifteenth day of February 1789 and that she knows that the said Henry House and Nancy his wife lived together for some time in the same Town where the New Ark Mount Old in said Town of Minden further saith not Sworn & subscribed before me this 4th day of September 1858                                 her John W. Heason Justice } of the Peace                                 }      Margaret   X  Zimmerman                                                        mark  I, John W. Heason a Justice of the Peace of the Town of Minden in the County of Montgomery before whom the above affidavit was taken do hereby certify that I am well acquainted with Margaret Zimmerman and do know her to be a person of good Character for truth and veracity and her statement entitled to credit and that she was not taught to write and did make her mark ill before me Sept 4th 1858               John W. Heason Justice  State of New York Montgomery County Clerkâ€™s Office } I certify that John W. Heason Esq. whose name is subscribed to the Jurat of the foregoing affidavit & proceedings was on the day of the date thereof a Justice of the Peace in & for the County of Montgomery, duly elected and qualified and that the signature to the same is his genuine signature.  In Testimony whereof I have hereunto set my hand and affixed my official seal this Eleventh day of September in the year 1858                                       J.R. Lowrie, Clerk

transcripts.extracted_text: State of New York Montgomery fs [illegible] Margaret Zimmerman being duly sworn deposeth & saith that she is acquainted with Henry House and Nancy House at the time they were married that she was Present at the Wedding and that she was also Married at the same time at my father House in Minden in said County and that Dominie Peck performed the Marriage Ceremony on the fifteenth day of february 1789 and that she knows that the said Henry House and Nancy his wife Lived together for some time in the same house where she this deponent did in said Town of Minden further saith not Sworn & Subscribed before me                   Margaret X Zimmerman this 4th day of September 1838                                   mark John W Haeven Justice of the Peace  I John W Haeven a Justice of the Peace of the Town of Minden in the County of Montgomery before whom the above affidavit was taken do hereby Certify that I am well acquainted with Margaret Zimmerman and do know her to be a person of good Character for truth and veracity and her statement entitled to Credit and that she was not taught to write and did make her mark before me Sept 4th 1838  John. W. Haeven Justice  State of New York Montgomery County   Clerks Office fs I Certify that John W Haeven Esqr whose name                     is subscribed to the jurat & c of the foregoing                     affidavit of proceeding was on the day of its date                     therein a Justice of the Peace in & for the County                     of Montgomery duly elected and qualified                     and that the signature to the same is his Genuine signature                     In Witness whereof I have hereunto set                     my hand and affixed my official seal this fourth day of September                     in the year 1838                                             A J Comrie Clerk
